summary: Adds 4 new decay-ish spells with new visuals. Apprentice, Adept, Expert and Master level.
descriptionHtml:
=========================================================================================
GOLDEN RULE OF THE NEXUS: PASS IN SILENCE IF YOU DON'T LIKE IT!
=========================================================================================

========================================================================================
UPDATE: Changed Greater Ruins visual effect because the old one wasn't so necromantic at all.

Video link: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=48io9ED2c0o
=========================================================================================

I'm a nut when it comes to necromancy and similar stuff, so i created some spells to have something more Decay-ish as an effect.Hurling icy spears through skyrim gets boring after a while.
Mostly created for personal use but i thought this may please some people on the nexus.


1.Installation
Pop the esp into your data folder and activate it in the skyrim launcher. Delete the esp in order to uninstall this mod.

2. What Spells are added and what their effects are.

Apprentice: Everlasting Decay - Target takes 10 poison damage for 30 seconds
Adept: Volatile Decay - Target takes 25 poison damage for 5 seconds
Expert: Decay Flesh - Target takes 55 poison damage for 5 seconds
Master: Greater Ruin: Everyone around you will rot and die taking 120 poison damage for 4 seconds.

[b]The Perk Augmented Flames also affect the Spells.[/b]

Some people might ask, why does the apprentice spell more overall damage than adept and expert? well that's simple, use it as a damage over time source to support yourself in combat against tougher enemies. However, the other spells may deal less damage, but they deal faster damage, so if you need to get down to business before having an axe/greatsword in your face, you know which spell you need to use.

"But Greater Ruin is overpowered!"
for starters, its the master spell of the line, then there is that spell in the Dungeons and Dragons universe with the same name, which is an Epic Spell (google it if you have no idea what i mean by "Epic Spell", it's not meant to be just epic) hence it will flatout kick ass!

The spells are poison based and come in 2 versions, the "Supremacy" version in which those spells ignore resistance and the "not so supreme version" where the spells are influenced by resistance (99% of all undead are immune to it with that).


3. Where can you get the spells.
There are 4 spell tomes in Wuunferth the Unliving's room in the windhelm palace, just to the left on the desk when you enter the room.

No quest or anything needed, like i said, did this mostly for myself.

4 Incompatibilities.
Prolly conflicts with anything that modifies the Cell where Wuunferth the Unliving resides in.

5. Credits & Persmission

Bethesda Softworks
acran2004

Ask me per PM here on the nexus if you want to use those spells for modding.

Have fun!
author: acran2004
